name: PythonToolInstaller
description: Acquires a specific version of Python from Azure storage, the local file system or file share, or URL and adds it to the build agent.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Python version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Human-readable name for the Python version you are installing.

inputs.name: architectureOption
inputs.label: Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: The bitness of the Python version.

inputs.name: installationSource
inputs.label: Installation source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Source for the compressed Python distribution.

inputs.name: compressedFile
inputs.label: Compressed file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a compressed file containing the compiled Python distribution. The path can be in your source repository, a local path on the agent, or a file share accessible by the agent. Supported file types are .tar, .tar.gz / .tgz, .zip, and .7z.

inputs.name: azureResourceManagerEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager subscription.

inputs.name: azureStorageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage account name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic and Resource Manager storage accounts are listed. Select the storage account name in which the Python distribution is located.

inputs.name: azureContainerName
inputs.label: Container name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container in which the Python distribution is located.

inputs.name: azureCommonVirtualFile
inputs.label: Common virtual path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the Python distribution inside the Azure storage container.

inputs.name: url
inputs.label: URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: URL pointing to the compressed Python distribution for download. Supported file types are .tar, .tar.gz / .tgz, .zip, and .7z.

inputs.name: destinationDirectory
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Destination directory into which the Python distribution should be extracted.

inputs.name: cleanDestinationDirectory
inputs.label: Clean destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to clean the destination directory before the Python distribution is extracted into it.
